segment.source: Common Migration Scenarios (Windows 10)
segment.target: Common Migration Scenarios (Windows 10)

segment.source: Common Migration Scenarios
segment.target: Common Migration Scenarios

segment.source: Common Migration Scenarios
segment.target: Common Migration Scenarios

segment.source: You use the User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 when hardware and/or operating system upgrades are planned for a large number of computers.
segment.target: You use the User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 when hardware and/or operating system upgrades are planned for a large number of computers.

segment.source: USMT manages the migration of an end-user's digital identity by capturing the user's operating-system settings, application settings, and personal files from a source computer and reinstalling them on a destination computer after the upgrade has occurred.
segment.target: USMT manages the migration of an end-user's digital identity by capturing the user's operating-system settings, application settings, and personal files from a source computer and reinstalling them on a destination computer after the upgrade has occurred.

segment.source: One common scenario when only the operating system, and not the hardware, is being upgraded is referred to as PC refresh.
segment.target: One common scenario when only the operating system, and not the hardware, is being upgraded is referred to as PC refresh.

segment.source: A second common scenario is known as PC replacement, where one piece of hardware is being replaced, typically by newer hardware and a newer operating system.
segment.target: A second common scenario is known as PC replacement, where one piece of hardware is being replaced, typically by newer hardware and a newer operating system.

segment.source: PC-Refresh
segment.target: PC-Refresh

segment.source: The following diagram shows a PC-refresh migration, also known as a computer refresh migration.
segment.target: The following diagram shows a PC-refresh migration, also known as a computer refresh migration.

segment.source: First, the administrator migrates the user state from a source computer to an intermediate store.
segment.target: First, the administrator migrates the user state from a source computer to an intermediate store.

segment.source: After installing the operating system, the administrator migrates the user state back to the source computer.
segment.target: After installing the operating system, the administrator migrates the user state back to the source computer.

segment.source: usmt pc refresh scenario
segment.target: usmt pc refresh scenario

segment.source: Scenario One: PC-refresh offline using Windows PE and a hard-link migration store
segment.target: Scenario One: PC-refresh offline using Windows PE and a hard-link migration store

segment.source: A company has just received funds to update the operating system on all of its computers in the accounting department to Windows 10.
segment.target: A company has just received funds to update the operating system on all of its computers in the accounting department to Windows 10.

segment.source: Each employee will keep the same computer, but the operating system on each computer will be updated.
segment.target: Each employee will keep the same computer, but the operating system on each computer will be updated.

segment.source: In this scenario, the update is being handled completely offline, without a network connection.
segment.target: In this scenario, the update is being handled completely offline, without a network connection.

segment.source: An administrator uses Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) and a hard-link migration store to save each user state to their respective computer.
segment.target: An administrator uses Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) and a hard-link migration store to save each user state to their respective computer.

segment.source: On each computer, the administrator boots the machine into WinPE and runs the ScanState command-line tool, specifying the /hardlink /nocompress command-line options.
segment.target: On each computer, the administrator boots the machine into WinPE and runs the ScanState command-line tool, specifying the /hardlink /nocompress command-line options.

segment.source: ScanState saves the user state to a hard-link migration store on each computer, improving performance by minimizing network traffic as well as minimizing migration failures on computers with very limited space available on the hard drive.
segment.target: ScanState saves the user state to a hard-link migration store on each computer, improving performance by minimizing network traffic as well as minimizing migration failures on computers with very limited space available on the hard drive.

segment.source: On each computer, the administrator installs the company’s standard operating environment (SOE) which includes Windows 10 and other company applications.
segment.target: On each computer, the administrator installs the company’s standard operating environment (SOE) which includes Windows 10 and other company applications.

segment.source: The administrator runs the LoadState command-line tool on each computer.
segment.target: The administrator runs the LoadState command-line tool on each computer.

segment.source: LoadState restores each user state back to each computer.
segment.target: LoadState restores each user state back to each computer.

segment.source: Scenario Two: PC-refresh using a compressed migration store
segment.target: Scenario Two: PC-refresh using a compressed migration store

segment.source: A company has just received funds to update the operating system on all of its computers to Windows 10.
segment.target: A company has just received funds to update the operating system on all of its computers to Windows 10.

segment.source: Each employee will keep the same computer, but the operating system on each computer will be updated.
segment.target: Each employee will keep the same computer, but the operating system on each computer will be updated.

segment.source: In this scenario, an administrator uses a compressed migration store to save the user states to a server.
segment.target: In this scenario, an administrator uses a compressed migration store to save the user states to a server.

segment.source: The administrator runs the ScanState command-line tool on each computer.
segment.target: The administrator runs the ScanState command-line tool on each computer.

segment.source: ScanState saves each user state to a server.
segment.target: ScanState saves each user state to a server.

segment.source: On each computer, the administrator installs the company's standard SOE which includes Windows 10 and other company applications.
segment.target: On each computer, the administrator installs the company's standard SOE which includes Windows 10 and other company applications.

segment.source: The administrator runs the LoadState command-line tool on each source computer, and LoadState restores each user state back to the computer.
segment.target: The administrator runs the LoadState command-line tool on each source computer, and LoadState restores each user state back to the computer.

segment.source: Scenario Three: PC-refresh using a hard-link migration store
segment.target: Scenario Three: PC-refresh using a hard-link migration store

segment.source: A company has just received funds to update the operating system on all of its computers to Windows 10.
segment.target: A company has just received funds to update the operating system on all of its computers to Windows 10.

segment.source: Each employee will keep the same computer, but the operating system on each computer will be updated.
segment.target: Each employee will keep the same computer, but the operating system on each computer will be updated.

segment.source: In this scenario, an administrator uses a hard-link migration store to save each user state to their respective computer.
segment.target: In this scenario, an administrator uses a hard-link migration store to save each user state to their respective computer.

segment.source: The administrator runs the ScanState command-line tool on each computer, specifying the /hardlink /nocompress command-line options.
segment.target: The administrator runs the ScanState command-line tool on each computer, specifying the /hardlink /nocompress command-line options.

segment.source: ScanState saves the user state to a hard-link migration store on each computer, improving performance by minimizing network traffic as well as minimizing migration failures on computers with very limited space available on the hard drive.
segment.target: ScanState saves the user state to a hard-link migration store on each computer, improving performance by minimizing network traffic as well as minimizing migration failures on computers with very limited space available on the hard drive.

segment.source: On each computer, the administrator installs the company's SOE which includes Windows 10 and other company applications.
segment.target: On each computer, the administrator installs the company's SOE which includes Windows 10 and other company applications.

segment.source: The administrator runs the LoadState command-line tool on each computer.
segment.target: The administrator runs the LoadState command-line tool on each computer.

segment.source: LoadState restores each user state back on each computer.
segment.target: LoadState restores each user state back on each computer.

segment.source: Scenario Four: PC-refresh using Windows.old folder and a hard-link migration store
segment.target: Scenario Four: PC-refresh using Windows.old folder and a hard-link migration store

segment.source: A company has decided to update the operating system on all of its computers to Windows 10.
segment.target: A company has decided to update the operating system on all of its computers to Windows 10.

segment.source: Each employee will keep the same computer, but the operating system on each computer will be updated.
segment.target: Each employee will keep the same computer, but the operating system on each computer will be updated.

segment.source: In this scenario, an administrator uses Windows.old and a hard-link migration store to save each user state to their respective computer.
segment.target: In this scenario, an administrator uses Windows.old and a hard-link migration store to save each user state to their respective computer.

segment.source: The administrator clean installs Windows 10 on each computer, making sure that the Windows.old directory is created by installing Windows 10 without formatting or repartitioning and by selecting a partition that contains the previous version of Windows.
segment.target: The administrator clean installs Windows 10 on each computer, making sure that the Windows.old directory is created by installing Windows 10 without formatting or repartitioning and by selecting a partition that contains the previous version of Windows.

segment.source: On each computer, the administrator installs the company’s SOE which includes company applications.
segment.target: On each computer, the administrator installs the company’s SOE which includes company applications.

segment.source: The administrator runs the ScanState and LoadState command-line tools successively on each computer while specifying the /hardlink /nocompress command-line options.
segment.target: The administrator runs the ScanState and LoadState command-line tools successively on each computer while specifying the /hardlink /nocompress command-line options.

segment.source: PC-Replacement
segment.target: PC-Replacement

segment.source: The following diagram shows a PC-replacement migration.
segment.target: The following diagram shows a PC-replacement migration.

segment.source: First, the administrator migrates the user state from the source computer to an intermediate store.
segment.target: First, the administrator migrates the user state from the source computer to an intermediate store.

segment.source: After installing the operating system on the destination computer, the administrator migrates the user state from the store to the destination computer.
segment.target: After installing the operating system on the destination computer, the administrator migrates the user state from the store to the destination computer.

segment.source: usmt pc replace scenario
segment.target: usmt pc replace scenario

segment.source: Scenario One: Offline migration using WinPE and an external migration store
segment.target: Scenario One: Offline migration using WinPE and an external migration store

segment.source: A company is allocating 20 new computers to users in the accounting department.
segment.target: A company is allocating 20 new computers to users in the accounting department.

segment.source: The users each have a source computer with their files and settings.
segment.target: The users each have a source computer with their files and settings.

segment.source: In this scenario, migration is being handled completely offline, without a network connection.
segment.target: In this scenario, migration is being handled completely offline, without a network connection.

segment.source: On each source computer, an administrator boots the machine into WinPE and runs ScanState to collect the user state to either a server or an external hard disk.
segment.target: On each source computer, an administrator boots the machine into WinPE and runs ScanState to collect the user state to either a server or an external hard disk.

segment.source: On each new computer, the administrator installs the company's SOE which includes Windows 10 and other company applications.
segment.target: On each new computer, the administrator installs the company's SOE which includes Windows 10 and other company applications.

segment.source: On each of the new computers, the administrator runs the LoadState tool, restoring each user state from the migration store to one of the new computers.
segment.target: On each of the new computers, the administrator runs the LoadState tool, restoring each user state from the migration store to one of the new computers.

segment.source: Scenario Two: Manual network migration
segment.target: Scenario Two: Manual network migration

segment.source: A company receives 50 new laptops for their managers and needs to reallocate 50 older laptops to new employees.
segment.target: A company receives 50 new laptops for their managers and needs to reallocate 50 older laptops to new employees.

segment.source: In this scenario, an administrator runs the ScanState tool from the cmd prompt on each computer to collect the user states and save them to a server in a compressed migration store.
segment.target: In this scenario, an administrator runs the ScanState tool from the cmd prompt on each computer to collect the user states and save them to a server in a compressed migration store.

segment.source: The administrator runs the ScanState tool on each of the manager’s old laptops, and saves each user state to a server.
segment.target: The administrator runs the ScanState tool on each of the manager’s old laptops, and saves each user state to a server.

segment.source: On the new laptops, the administrator installs the company's SOE, which includes Windows 10 and other company applications.
segment.target: On the new laptops, the administrator installs the company's SOE, which includes Windows 10 and other company applications.

segment.source: The administrator runs the LoadState tool on the new laptops to migrate the managers’ user states to the appropriate computer.
segment.target: The administrator runs the LoadState tool on the new laptops to migrate the managers’ user states to the appropriate computer.

segment.source: The new laptops are now ready for the managers to use.
segment.target: The new laptops are now ready for the managers to use.

segment.source: On the old computers, the administrator installs the company’s SOE, which includes Windows 10, Microsoft Office, and other company applications.
segment.target: On the old computers, the administrator installs the company’s SOE, which includes Windows 10, Microsoft Office, and other company applications.

segment.source: The old computers are now ready for the new employees to use.
segment.target: The old computers are now ready for the new employees to use.

segment.source: Scenario Three: Managed network migration
segment.target: Scenario Three: Managed network migration

segment.source: A company is allocating 20 new computers to users in the accounting department.
segment.target: A company is allocating 20 new computers to users in the accounting department.

segment.source: The users each have a source computer that contains their files and settings.
segment.target: The users each have a source computer that contains their files and settings.

segment.source: An administrator uses a management technology such as a logon script or a batch file to run ScanState on each source computer to collect the user states and save them to a server in a compressed migration store.
segment.target: An administrator uses a management technology such as a logon script or a batch file to run ScanState on each source computer to collect the user states and save them to a server in a compressed migration store.

segment.source: On each source computer, the administrator runs the ScanState tool using Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM), Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT), a logon script, a batch file, or a non-Microsoft management technology.
segment.target: On each source computer, the administrator runs the ScanState tool using Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM), Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT), a logon script, a batch file, or a non-Microsoft management technology.

segment.source: ScanState collects the user state from each source computer and then saves it to a server.
segment.target: ScanState collects the user state from each source computer and then saves it to a server.

segment.source: On each new computer, the administrator installs the company's SOE, which includes Windows 10 and other company applications.
segment.target: On each new computer, the administrator installs the company's SOE, which includes Windows 10 and other company applications.

segment.source: On each of the new computers, the administrator runs the LoadState tool using System Center Configuration Manager, a logon script, a batch file, or a non-Microsoft management technology.
segment.target: On each of the new computers, the administrator runs the LoadState tool using System Center Configuration Manager, a logon script, a batch file, or a non-Microsoft management technology.

segment.source: LoadState migrates each user state from the migration store to one of the new computers.
segment.target: LoadState migrates each user state from the migration store to one of the new computers.
